channel.title: BBC News - Home

item.title: Covid: EU starts mass vaccination in 'touching moment of unity'
item.description: Care home residents and health staff are first to get jabs as the 27-state bloc begins immunisations.

item.title: Covid: Trump fails to sign economic relief bill into law
item.description: Millions of Americans temporarily lose unemployment benefits after the deadline for signing passes.

item.title: Nashville explosion 'probably suicide bombing'
item.description: Investigators conduct DNA tests after human remains are found and a house is searched.

item.title: Iran: Climbers die in blizzards and avalanche
item.description: At least 10 climbers are killed and seven others are missing in the Alborz mountains near Tehran.

item.title: Brexit: What are the key points of the deal?
item.description: These are the most important aspects of the UK-EU deal, and how it could affect our day-to-day lives.

item.title: Coronavirus: What has Covid done for climate crisis?
item.description: Lockdowns around the world have led to record falls in CO2 emissions. But will this lead to long lasting change?

item.title: Storm Bella: Gusts of more than 100mph recorded in UK
item.description: A warning for snow and ice is in place for Northern Ireland and parts of England, Wales and Scotland.

item.title: Seven killed in knife attack in China's Liaoning province
item.description: At least seven people are killed in a stabbing frenzy in the city of Kaiyuan, with a suspect in custody.

item.title: Central African Republic election: Polls open amid fears of more violence
item.description: Three UN peacekeepers were killed before the election, as tension grows between rebels and the state.

item.title: Former wrestler Brodie Lee dies aged 41
item.description: The wrestling world pays tribute to Jon Huber, who was known to fans as Brodie Lee or Luke Harper.

item.title: Pooch on the pitch causes match delay
item.description: A dog paused a football game for three minutes, as it ran around with a football boot in its mouth.

item.title: Irish state papers: IRA 'wanted to exclude Sinn Féin from talks'
item.description: Irish government papers from 1990 suggest some IRA bosses did not share the party's socialist views.

item.title: 'Super recogniser' policeman spots 2,000 suspects
item.description: PCSO Andy Pope says his talent for remembering faces is "impossible to explain".

item.title: Rahane gives India control of Boxing Day Test
item.description: Stand-in captain Ajinkya Rahane's brilliant unbeaten century gives India control of the second Test against Australia on day two.

item.title: Covid in the classroom: How the pandemic changed these three teachers' lives
item.description: Three teachers in the US reflect on how drastically their jobs have changed during 2020.

item.title: Black Lives Matter: My year as an accidental anti-racism activist
item.description: Covid and Black Lives Matter take wedding photographer Tash Jones in an unexpected direction.

item.title: Ikram Abdi Omar: the hijabi model breaking boundaries
item.description: Ikram Abdi Omar was the UK's first hijab-wearing model to feature on the cover of Vogue.

item.title: 2020 and me: 'EndSARS was our Black Lives Matter'
item.description: After protests, a strike, and lockdown, Kiki, a student from Lagos, Nigeria, can’t wait for the year to be over.

item.title: Christmas Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles jumper a Twitter hit
item.description: Hannah George's mum creates a replica of a jumper knitted by her daughter's gran 30 years ago.

item.title: Gingerbread monolith appears in San Francisco's Corona Heights
item.description: The tall, baked structure appeared in Corona Heights Park on Christmas Day, delighting locals.

item.title: Extreme E: Lewis Hamilton and electric car racing
item.description: Lewis Hamilton isn't just the world's most successful F1 driver, he's also a key backer of a new off-road electric vehicle racing series called Extreme E.

item.title: US presidents' pets: Biden dogs Major and Champ to restore White House tradition
item.description: From Socks the cat to Macaroni the pony, the US presidential tradition is returning with Joe Biden.

item.title: Has Thomas Becket's treasured 'little book' been found?
item.description: Thomas Becket, killed in Canterbury in 1170, was attached to a "little book", which may now have been found in Cambridge.

item.title: Seismic change: How Covid-19 altered world events in 2020
item.description: The pandemic affected us all - and shaped global issues, with knock-on effects for millions.

item.title: How Ugandan Nasa scientist Catherine Nakalembe uses satellites to boost farming
item.description: Catherine Nakalembe won this year's Africa Food Prize for pioneering work using satellite images.

item.title: Why is India denying prisoners spectacles and straws?
item.description: Jail officials have been called out for being cruel to prisoners - especially the government's critics.

item.title: Art in 2021: The highlights to hope for
item.description: Some exhibitions and galleries scheduled to open, including Tutankhamun relics and a movie museum.

item.title: The family with no fingerprints
item.description: A family in Bangladesh struggles with an extremely rare genetic condition, "immigration delay disease".

item.title: The casualties of this year's viral conspiracy theories
item.description: Conspiracy theories ripped through the internet this year, destroying relationships and endangering lives.

item.title: 'The year city-dwellers needed my photos of country life'
item.description: Farmer and writer James Rebanks explains how the coronavirus pandemic has affected him.

item.title: Covid-19: Sri Lanka forcibly cremates Muslim baby sparking anger
item.description: Sri Lankan officials insist on cremating all those who die with Covid-19, angering Muslim families.

item.title: Brady inspires Buccaneers into NFL play-offs
item.description: Tom Brady helps the Tampa Bay Buccaneers secure an NFL first play-off spot since 2007 in a win over the Detroit Lions.

item.title: Houston lose in overtime to Portland in their delayed NBA season-opener
item.description: An understrength Houston Rockets side start their NBA campaign with a narrow overtime loss to the Portland Trail Blazers.

item.title: Ronaldo, Ramos, Celtic and more - who could be men's football record-breakers in 2021?
item.description: Cristiano Ronaldo, Sergio Ramos and Celtic are among the possible record-breakers in 2021. So what records could we see fall this year?

item.title: Andy Murray awarded wildcard for February's delayed Australian Open
item.description: Andy Murray gets a wildcard for February's Australian Open, two years after what looked like his final appearance.

item.title: Bamford's early penalty gives Leeds win over Burnley
item.description: Leeds bounce back from their heavy defeat at Old Trafford with a hard-earned victory over Burnley at Elland Road.

item.title: Changing fortunes? Arteta's 'special day' leaves Lampard 'angry'
item.description: Mikel Arteta hails Arsenal's win as 'a special day' but Frank Lampard calls his team 'lazy' after Chelsea's 3-1 defeat.
